title: Dense packing of xenon in an ultra-microporous metal–organic framework for benchmark xenon capture and separation

questions.question: What is the highest Xe storage density achieved by MOF-11 at ambient conditions?
Which material demonstrates record-high Xe uptake (4.0 mmol g−1) at 0.2 bar and 298 K?
What is the Xe/Kr selectivity of MOF-11 at 298 K and 1 bar?
How does MOF-11 compare to activated charcoal in terms of Xe capture and release?
questions.answer: MOF-11 exhibits the highest Xe storage density, record-high Xe uptake at 0.2 bar and 298 K, and concurrently high Xe/Kr selectivity, making it superior for Xe capture and separation.

questions.question: What strategy is employed by MOF-11 to achieve excellent Xe/Kr separation performance?
questions.answer: MOF-11 uses dense and staggered arrangement of the alkyl cavities and oppositely adjacent open Cu2+-metal sites along the small channels to provide strong binding affinity with Xe and enable the dense packing of Xe inside the pores.

questions.question: Is MOF-11's structure stable under water and chemical environments?
questions.answer: Yes, MOF-11 retains its structural integrity without phase change and loss of crystallinity observed after being soaked in different chemical environments, including water, HCl (pH 2), and NaOH (pH 10) aqueous solutions.

questions.question: What makes MOF-11 a benchmark material for Xe/Kr separation?
questions.answer: MOF-11's unique pore system, high Xe storage density, record-high Xe uptake, and high Xe/Kr selectivity make it a benchmark material for efficient Xe/Kr separation.

questions.question: True or False: MOF-11 exhibits a record high Xe adsorption capacity of 4.0 mmol g−1 at 298 K and 0.2 bar.
True or False: The Xe/Kr selectivity of MOF-11 decreases significantly when used in dynamic breakthrough experiments.
True or False: MOF-11's performance in Xe capture and separation is inferior to that of activated charcoal.
What is the role of the staggered arrangement of alkyl cavities and open Cu-metal sites in MOF-11?
questions.answer: The staggered arrangement provides strong binding affinity with Xe and enables the dense packing of Xe inside the pores, optimizing both Xe adsorption uptake and Xe/Kr selectivity.

questions.question: How does MOF-11's Xe storage density at 298 K and 1 bar compare to the density of liquid Xe?
questions.answer: MOF-11's Xe storage density of 2826 g/L at 298 K and 1 bar is slightly lower than the liquid Xe density (3058 g/L at 1 bar and 165 K), indicating highly efficient packing of Xe atoms inside the pores.

questions.question: True or False: MOF-11's structure changes significantly under water and chemical environments.
What experimental techniques were used to determine the Xe binding sites in MOF-11?
questions.answer: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction (SCXRD) measurements were performed on Xe-loaded MOF-11 crystals to determine the Xe binding sites.

questions.question: True or False: MOF-11's performance in Xe capture and separation degrades significantly after multiple cycles of use.
